article.title: Liquid crystals of hard rectangles on flat and cylindrical manifolds

multiple_choice_question.text: Which panel shows a system in the tetratic phase?
At approximately which aspect ratio (L/D) does the transition from isotropic to nematic/tetratic start occurring at higher area fractions (η) in both DFT and MC simulations?
What happens to the stability region of the smectic (S) phase as the external field amplitude (βVo) is increased?
choices: It expands to lower area fractions (η).
It shrinks to higher area fractions (η).

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the observation of tilted smectic and tilted columnar phases in MC simulations on a cylinder (Fig. 5b) primarily demonstrate?
choices: The system prefers aligning all particles parallel to the cylinder axis.
The external field is not strong enough to induce order on a curved manifold.
The system balances the aligning field with the geometric constraints of the cylinder.
DFT calculations are insufficient to predict complex order on curved manifolds.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend is observed for the average particle orientation (Φ_avg) as the cylinder circumference (C/L) approaches an integer multiple of the particle length (L) from below?
choices: The average orientation becomes more aligned with the cylinder axis.
The average orientation becomes more tilted with respect to the cylinder axis.
The average orientation remains largely unaffected.
The system transitions to a purely isotropic phase.
